comparison.title: Comparing Traditional & Modern Anal Fistula Treatments

definition.title: What is an Anal Fistula?
definition.content: An anal fistula is a small tunnel that develops between the end of the bowel and the skin near the anus. They are usually the result of an infection near the anus causing a collection of pus (an abscess) in the nearby tissue.

symptoms.title: Symptoms
listItems: Pain and swelling around the anus
Discharge of blood or pus from the anus

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: Anal fistulas usually require surgery as they do not heal by themselves. The type of surgery will depend on the position of your fistula but all aim to heal the fistula while avoiding damage to the sphincter muscles.
